comment:
* An amount of a specified unit, consisting of a Number and a Unit. * For example, a length measure consists of a Number and a length * unit, such as feet or meters. * *

Measure objects are parsed and formatted by subclasses of * MeasureFormat. * *

Measure objects are immutable. All subclasses must guarantee that. * (However, subclassing is discouraged.) * * @see java.lang.Number * @see android.icu.util.MeasureUnit * @see android.icu.text.MeasureFormat * @author Alan Liu

methods.name: public boolean equals(Object obj)
methods.comment:
* Returns true if the given object is equal to this object.
     * @return true if this object is equal to the given object

methods.name: private static boolean numbersEqual(Number a, Number b)
methods.comment: TODO improve this to catch more cases (two different longs that have same double values, BigDecimals, etc)

methods.name: public int hashCode()
methods.comment:
* Returns a hashcode for this object.
     * @return a 32-bit hash

methods.name: public String toString()
methods.comment:
* Returns a string representation of this object.
     * @return a string representation consisting of the ISO currency
     * code together with the numeric amount

methods.name: public Number getNumber()
methods.comment:
* Returns the numeric value of this object.
     * @return this object's Number

methods.name: public MeasureUnit getUnit()
methods.comment:
* Returns the unit of this object.
     * @return this object's Unit

methodNames: private static boolean numbersEqual(Number a, Number b)
